dataset.title: Soil nitrogen transformations in 3 alpine plant communities.

abstract.para: Net nitrogen mineralization, nitrification, and microbial nitrogen were measured in dry, moist, and wet meadow plots in 3 different locations on Niwot Ridge: a south-facing slope in the Boulder watershed, across the Saddle, and a north-facing slope. Measurements were made on a monthly basis while soils were unfrozen and once over the period of frozen soil conditions. Associated soil measurements included moisture, temperature, organic N and C, total P, and texture.

description.para: The documentation section of this file was developed from the NWT LTER Data Directory (Symphony files DDABSTRA.WR1, DDMASTER.WR1, DDVARIAB.WR1; last updated 16 December 1991) by Susan Kindig and Rick Ingersoll in early November 1992. Additional information for the documentation section, as well as the header and data sections were supplied by Melany Fisk on 8 December 1992. [RCI, 8 December 1992] This file was put under sccs control on 30 March 1993. See the appropriate history file for additional log information. [RCI 30 March 1993] Minor modifications were made comments and header sections on 12 July 1993.[RCI 12 July 1993] Trace gas plot locations surveyed by Tim Bardsley and Mike Hartman on 6 July 1994 were added to the comments section on 14 July 1994.[RCI 14 July 1994] Investigator contact information was updated on 23 May 1996.[MAH 23 May 1996] Investigator contact information was updated, and the Fisk 1995, and Fisk et al. 1998 citations were added on 2 December 1998.[MAH 2 December 1998]
